item.title: Il segno del Coyote
item.description: 1963 Italian-Spanish adventure Western movie directed by Mario Caiano

item.title: God Made Them... I Kill Them
item.description: God Made Them... I Kill Them is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written by Fernando Di Leo and directed by Paolo Bianchini.

item.title: I Am Sartana, Trade Your Guns for a Coffin
item.description: Sartana's Here… Trade Your Pistol for a Coffin is a 1970 spaghetti western that is the third of the Sartana film series with George Hilton taking over the lead role from Gianni Garko. The film was shot in Italy and directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Vengeance Is My Forgiveness
item.description: Vengeance Is My Forgiveness is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Roberto Mauri.

item.title: My Name is Nobody
item.description: My Name Is Nobody is a 1973 comedy spaghetti western starring Terence Hill and Henry Fonda. The film was directed by Tonino Valerii.

item.title: Fury of Johnny Kid
item.description: Fury of Johnny Kid is a 1967 Italian-Spanish film directed by Gianni Puccini. The Italian and Spanish versions of the film have different ending. The film is a spaghetti western version of William Shakespeare's tragedy Romeo and Juliet.

item.title: Dead Men Don't Count
item.description: Dead Men Don't Count is a 1968 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Rafael Romero Marchent.

item.title: Find a Place to Die
item.description: Find a Place to Die (1968) is a spaghetti western starring Jeffrey Hunter and Pascale Petit. It was co-written and directed by Giuliano Carnimeo with sequences directed by Hugo Fregonese who also produced the film.

item.title: Django Kill
item.description: Django Kill... If You Live, Shoot! is a 1967 film directed by Giulio Questi.

item.title: Ringo the Lone Rider
item.description: Ringo the Lone Rider is a 1968 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti western film directed by Rafael Romero Marchent.
